verse.name: c1a
verse.lines:
How marvelous!
how wonderful!
And my song shall ever be:

verse.name: c1b
verse.lines:
How marvelous!
how wonderful
Is my Savior’s love for me!

verse.name: v1a
verse.lines:
I stand amazed in the presence
Of Jesus the Nazarene,

verse.name: v1b
verse.lines:
And wonder how
He could love me,
A sinner, condemned, unclean.

verse.name: v2a
verse.lines:
For me it was in the garden
He prayed:
“Not My will, but Thine,”

verse.name: v2b
verse.lines:
He had no tears for
His own grief’s,
But sweat-drops
of blood for mine.

verse.name: v3a
verse.lines:
In pity angels beheld Him,
And came from the world of light

verse.name: v3b
verse.lines:
To comfort Him in the sorrows
He bore for my soul that night.

verse.name: v4a
verse.lines:
He took my sins and my sorrows,
He made His very own;

verse.name: v4b
verse.lines:
He bore the burden to Calva’ry,
And suffered, and died alone.

verse.name: v5a
verse.lines:
When with the ransomed in glory
His face I at last shall see,

verse.name: v5b
verse.lines:
‘Twill be my joy thro’ the ages
To sing of His love for me.
